values.comments:
This course prepares students specifically for a summer program in China. The class teaches students accepted to the program about orthotics and developmental disorders. It prepares students for a 17-day trip to rural China and Hong Kong during the summer where they build orthotic devices for children. 

Students enjoyed the course immensely, claiming it to be the best they have ever taken in Penn. “Every BE major should know about this opportunity,” said one student, “and take advantage of it.” “From Cantonese to orthotics, this project covered everything,” said another. The only downside of this course was lack of structure in terms of due dates. 

Professor Bogen was a great instructor. He effectively communicated the material, inspired interest in the students, and was accessible and willing to discuss course content and students’ problems. 

The course was considered to be moderately difficult, requiring a reasonable amount of work. The students learned a great deal from it in terms of knowledge, concepts, skills, and thinking ability. They agreed that it is a “fantastic course” and it was highly recommended to both majors and non-majors.
